what is known as a third eye or third ear -the ability to see and/or hear spirits and entities.

suicide. I've analyzed my situation and dealt with it. I'm alright now.

and found out about the spiritual dimension of my condition. Medical Science ignores the effects
of spirits, they only see it as a medical/physical condition, believing that you're just suffering
from auditory hallucination etc. But if you're really having an auditory hallucination as they say,

Swahili or robot-like speech ! Which means you're dealing with an intelligent being and your

places only. Do you have diabetes, arthritis or high blood pressure ONLY 10% of the day or in certain
places only ? Know what I'm saying. So clearly the medical profession won't be able to cure you, not
knowing what the real problem is. If you don/t believe then, do your own research, humor me.

What if, space-time existed. This would be of four dimensional reality. Now imagine, that a smaller three dimensional reality existed within that bigger four dimensional reality. The three dimensional reality would be a three dimensional reality because the people within it would always be confined to the "NOW" time. They do not extend across time. Now imagine that minds existed, in the four dimensional space-time reality. They could mess with those tiny 3D minds, and insert all sorts of things into those tiny 3D minds. They could insert sounds, voices, visual images, there is no end to what they could do.

How could we prove that there are two different realities, the 3D reality, and the 4D reality. Well, we could perform the famous too slit light experiment. If the experiment is being governed from the outside, the 4D side that is outside of the "NOW" time, and the experiment was run for say 5 minutes, all of the photons involved would interfere with each other over that time period because it is a four dimensional event. This would create an interference pattern that would be seen at the destination wall or screen. From the outside, this would be seen as being a single 5 minute 4D event. However, if we placed detectors at the two slits to detect the photons passing through each slit, each detection would be an event in itself. Thus we would have broken down the experiment into real time events. Thus it could no longer be governed from the outside as a single four dimensional event. In turn, there would no longer be an interference pattern seen at the destination screen or wall, now that all the photon's are no longer interfering with each other, now that the experiment is being governed from the inside, the much smaller 3D side.

To really understand the minds mechanism of this fenomenon, it's importan to ask what trigggered this behavior of the mind? Symtoms can only truly be understood when we go deep into the question of the cause. A medical pill is not the solution. Yes genetics play a role in how we cope with the world. But geneticts are tendencies and not recipes of how we gonna develope. To understand a skizofrenic person we have to stop calling it a disease in the way we do today. Studies and treatments has showed that dealing with pass trauma and taking your voices seriously, to accept them and understand the roots of these voice is actually a invitation for help from the wounded subconscious mind and body. However skizofrenic conditions doesn't mean that you are more emotionally or physically traumatized as others, your mind, body and spirit is just dealing with it through hallucinations. What might destroy us is the force that will save us. ❤

Try meditation. Meditation is the practice of quieting the mind. It can be difficult even for people who do not hear voices but with practice becomes easier. I believe that state of mind has much to do with the types of voices heard. If one, does a lot of negative self talk and has a negative outlook on life then the voices tend to be negative but this can be changed to positive and then the voice change to positive. I'm not saying it's easy to do this, however, it gets easier with practice. I believe showing the voices love and compassion is also key. Try  telling them you love them and you want them to get out of the sadness they feel. You want them to be happy. Also looking at it from a different perspective can almost immediately shift your vibration and shift the "evil" voices to more positive or even stop them all together. There is nothing wrong with you. You are loved and you will improve. Believe it and you will receive it. Sorry for that last little cliche.

My mother's a schizophrenic. We didn't know that for 25 years. I need some suggestions. My mom had constant fear of terrorists who'd kill her and our family because of her. She was a teacher and was always fearful of people plotting against her. My Elder brother and Father used to beat her up for almost a decade or around it. I remember that me and my twin used to run away with our mom at midnight outside our home saving our life because we feared our father would kill our mom and we'd stray all the night on the roads till morning when my father would be asleep and back to normal from his alcohol levels . She would get ready and leave for her school to teach. She kept earning for us children to feed us never mentioning her conditions. We always believed it was God with us. And then we grew and became mature but our mom started fearing even more. Fast forward - Dec 2017- She was 66 years old and started talking to random imaginary people which we never saw her do all these years and it was scary. A week later she jumped up the 10 foot wall (she's only 5 foot 2 inches tall) and ran away running on the streets shouting terrorists have come for her and she wasn't even recognising me , we literally had to wait 16 days for her appointment to the doctor who treated her way back in 1999 and told my father it was depression (which was true and very vague as an explanation). This January 1st , 2018 I made notes of her behaviour all these years including her suicidal tendencies (poison drinking and then drinking fuel to kill herself) and talking to angels and God ,etc. We got her on this drug Risperidone by discontinuing Alprazolam (which she was immune to and it didn't work for her rather increasing her symptoms) . Risperidone worked awesomely after a period of a week and she has improved since January but recently now in May 2018 ,she's again started to have fears of neighbours plotting against killing our family and people listening to her (which she always had in all these 25 years) but she doesn't talk to random voices or have hallucinations like she did in December. My questions are :1)is she getting immune to Risperidone ? 2) Is her condition reverting to her maniac phase? 3) I stay in India and doctors here only experiment on patients here and even the best doctor in my city doesn't discuss much about her details with me what options do I have ? 4) are there questions you could suggest that I should ask to her doctor when I visit him next month on her routine checkup? 5) Is there anything that I could care for as she doesn't speak much after the medications and she's not expressive I fear she's hiding something. My mom is the world to me and I am not getting married so that I don't have to divide my time on a wife and a baby so to say. I want to do everything for my mom that I Can ,I just want her to have her old age years happy because she had enough of violence and social boycott and seeing her sleep beside me in that comfort and deep sleep is the most beautiful time of the day for me. My mother sleeping without fearing for her life ,without her loved ones abandoning her when she needs help is beyond expressions. I can't even imagine what my life would have been had my mother not worked and raised us up despite her illness and took horrifying beatings , burning, slitting, bone breaking ,thrashing my Dad gave her then and my mom would simply earn for us to feed us ,to raise us and wake up again and be beaten and treated like a housemaid. I want to be the best son and I feel sad that we ignored her conditions but on that would be the fault of her doctor who never told us that she suffered from schizophrenia and not depression. Thanks for reading what my heart felt. I pray for everyone who is suffering from this to get well soon and be brave ,you guys are heroes in real life. Prayers from India ! And reply me if you can explain anything about my mother .

I have Maledaptive Daydreaming which causes me to have very visit daydreams. Sometimes I respond to these daydreams out loud when I'm alone (or rarer in public) People with Maledative daydream are aware they are daydream but cannot(usually) stop or start the daydream themselves. A lot of the time characters from their favorite movies, books, etc. Are in it and play a huge role. People develops MD from early childhood trauma in the most extreme sense while others develop it from simply being isolated in the developmental years of childhood. Simply not having other kids to play with outside between the ages of 4-10 yrs and nothing but your toys and imagination can have the brain make friends for itself and thus start the process of MD. It sticks with people their enter life and can impair them to the point they can't function at work properly for being 'Lost in Thought'. They sometimes laugh randomly, frown, and make hand gestures to themselves while Daydreaming though most of the time they just look like they are staring off into space like any normal person who's bored. MD is not expected in the medical field and no one knows how to treat it expect with having the person in social settings where they are constantly doing something so the brain doesn't begin to daydream.

I read many comments about people who hear their name called while being exposed to loud noise. Hearing the door bell while vacuuming the house.

Those are not sign of schizophrenia. They are just your brain try to guess things in a stressful environment. Any engineer should be able to demonstrate mathematically how difficult it is to extract meaningful information from a noisy communication channel.

The success of USB electric protocol (and their close relative like SATA and older relative such as Ethernet) is based on advanced design where some part of the circuit try to adjust the DC level and AC and dynamically switch frequency to get the minimum number of error.

Believe it or not, each time you move the external hard drive or the cat just wiggle the USB wire, this change the frequency response and the computer and hard drive are constantly adjusting the electric signal and exchange command to repeat any corrupted packet.

In the case of our brain, we evolved a very sophisticated system to extract faint sound in the middle of loud noise. Hearing a call for help in the forest over the bird song, or the faint sound of a predator when the wind rattle every leave, these are example of a very complex process which can not be 100% reliable.

So, from time to time, the vacuum cleaner contain s stream of frequency similar to the door bell. You can ignore these noisy kids in the school yards but your brain will sound an internal alarm if it detect your name as part of that noise.

Science has accepted the fact that when we hear voices in our heads we are actually hearing reality. The point is we can choose if we want to listen to what we are being told or if we want to ignore it. There are those who cannot ignore it, but they are no longer being looked upon as crazy. It is only if those voices tell people to do something harmful - like voting a politician or drowning a rabbit or something like that, that people are concerned. Hearing voices used to be associated with scizophrenia, but now everyone has stopped believing that crap. 13 year old me took 800mg of niacin a day thinking it'd be a "natural, safe" treatment to my clinical depression and now i have permanent liver damage and cannot take medicines like tylenol. no medicine is completely safe, and sometimes you need to weigh the risks when considering whether or not to take medication.

i don't just say this as someone who suffers from depression, but severe ptsd and its related joys as well. should i spend my entire life with a resting heart rate of 90bpm and spend every other night awake until 7 am fearing that today's finally the day i'll be murdered, or should i extend my lifespan a little bit by NOT living in constant stress and providing my brain with some of the chemicals it literally does not create as it should? my choice is to die at 30 of a constant-stress-induced heart attack or to maybe push it another 30 years and actually feel like a person with loving relationships, aspirations and sleep.

ultimately whether you take medication or not is completely up to you and for some people it's just too much of a risk. but many people do not have much of an option. obviously you should try learning coping skills in therapy before resorting to heavy drugs with serious potential side effects but for everyone out there who's completely against the idea of medication for psychological disorders, just remember that not everyone has a very good selection of options. we're not dumb. people don't just start lithium if they can function in the smallest amount without medication. we all just want to make the most of our lives, and just like you can't talk the cancer away, there are some aspects of mental illnesses that are down to the physical and chemical level.

Don't, and I mean DON'T go to a psychiatrist especially to the "system" if you have voices and are mindful about them. They'll lock you up and restrain you and force-feed you meds. Hate on me all you want but voices are sometimes and a lot of the times manifestations or a coping mechanism of suppressed or subconscious needs that have been severely lacking in your life. Sometimes people who have this don't even know about it like abused people who couldn't remember their abuse, blocked out their abuse, or haven't connected the dots yet. See that as mental homework you needed to sort out that has piled up over the years and it's weighed down on you. Be mindful, be brave and face your problems, and most of all, always try to go natural 1st. And don't trust the system. Remember Garth Daniels.

Is it weird that multiple parts of my brain will pipe up with different pieces of information or whatever. So my "self talk" is less of a soliquolly and more of a dialouge/debate.
E.g. I have "the narrator". The narrator narrates what I'm doing or thinking as if it was in a book.
- The radio station plays music in my head as I do things too.
- The mathematician/scientist will solve random math problems that revolve around what I'm doing e.g estimating the number of classrooms in the school or looking at the adaptations of cats.
- There is a friendly "voice" that comforts overall me and gives genuine advice
- There is also jokey insult guy, who does jokey insults
- Then there's a general flow of conciousness interrupted by little questions and judgements. (I'm certain everyone has this)
- My decision making goes as follows: several parts of my brain will take up different sides of an argument and debate it out.

All these different things are different facets of myself. They come from within, and I don't physically hear them. (Although I have had a couple auditory hallucinations right before falling asleep.)
I don't hear "voices", just whispers.

Another interesting theory as to the higher prevalence of many mental illnesses, including schizophrenia, in comparison to many other diseases is that in our evolutionary past, the small subset of the population born with these traits would be seen as "hearing from the gods" and be venerated instead of stigmatized. Think of ancient oracles, or prophets.

Possessing the ability to think in ways the majority of the population would not, they could actually become leaders of a sort, ending with a greater chance to reproduce and pass on whatever genes caused their mental illness. On the same note, they could give rise to ideas and plans of action that resulted in a greater chance of survival for their group (as in tribe, village, city, etc.) which would then encourage the further growth of their group and with it, the genes that caused their mental malady.

When testing for illnesses that include "hearing voices" they make it clear to see if the voices the person is hearing is internal or external. Internal voices are NOT a trait of schizophrenia. Internal voices are very heavily linked to trauma, therefore linked to traumagenic illnesses. Schizophrenia in itself is not a traumagenic disorder, though trauma and stress can make symptoms worse. They feel that they are hearing the voices from an external force rather than internal, hense why people with DID have an easier time "hiding" their symptoms because they are aware that their voices are not external, therefore they do not mistake it for a voice everyone else can here.

+AsapSCIENCE The biggest study yet to look at schizophrenia and marijuana use showed that the idea that cannabis triggers schizophrenia is likely overestimated. Cocaine and other stimulants were more likely to cause it.

"Abstract:
BackgroundAlthough cannabis abuse (CA) is known to be associated with schizophrenia, the causal nature of this association is unclear, with prodromal effects complicating its interpretation.MethodFrom Swedish national registry databases, we used a co-relative case–control design with full-sibling, half-sibling and first-cousin comparisons, alongside a general Swedish population sample. Using ICD codes, 5456 individuals with an initial diagnosis of schizophrenia (2000–2010) were matched with five schizophrenia-free controls. We further identified first-cousin, half-sibling and full-sibling pairs discordant for CA and statistically extrapolated results for discordant monozygotic (MZ) twins.ResultsWithin the general Swedish population, CA was strongly associated with later schizophrenia [odds ratio (OR) 10.44, 95% confidence interval (CI) 8.99–12.11]. This association was substantially attenuated both by increasing temporal delays between CA exposure and schizophrenia diagnosis and by controlling for increasing degrees of familial confounding. Extrapolated discordant MZ pairs suggested that fully controlling for confounding familial factors reduced the association between CA and later schizophrenia to more modest levels (ORs of approximately 3.3 and 1.6 with 3- and 7-year temporal delays respectively). Opiate, sedative, cocaine/stimulant and hallucinogen abuse were also strongly associated with subsequent schizophrenia in the general population. After controlling for familial confounding, only cocaine/stimulant exposure remained associated.ConclusionsCA has an appreciable causal impact on future risk for schizophrenia. However, population-based estimates of cannabis–schizophrenia co-morbidity substantially overestimate their causal association. Predictions of the cases of schizophrenia that might be prevented by reduced cannabis consumption based on population associations are therefore likely to be considerably overestimated."

Giordano, G. N.; Ohlsson, H.; Sundquist, K.; Sundquist, J.; Kendler, K. S..Psychological Medicine (PSYCHOL MED), Jan2015; 45(2): 407-414. (8p)

I'd like to try and explain why many people with mental disorders don't always take their medicine. I have seen this up close with friends and an ex-girlfriend. While I think science has come a long way I don't think medicine against schizophrenia and related disorders are good for anyone who has this prescription. Along with anti-depressants I think medicine against schizophrenia are one of the least effective medicines out there. This is kind of a personal topic, considering my elder nephew had schizophrenia. And yes, he was part of the majority that didn't want to take his meds. It started okay, but he had that stubborn trait everyone in our family has (myself included) that we don't want to rely on medication too much. So he quit the meds as soon as he felt better. But since schizophrenia is a permanent disease, the symptoms returned shortly afterwards.
His family tried everything in order to convince him to take the meds, but eventually the voices in his head convinced him that his parents and siblings were trying to poison him, so it all went downhill until he reached the conclusion that every schizophrenia patient at this point reaches...


...
Suicide.
...
So yeah, i'm kind of surprised to hear that there are people that can get cured from schizophrenia, because all I heard was that it could not be cured and every one suffering from it would reach a similar end.

I just read the book, "A Beautiful Mind," and it detailed the accounts of John Nash and his struggle with schizophrenia. During low mental swings, he would claim to hear the voices of aliens, believed that secret messages were encoded in magazines, (he believed that a picture of the pope was really a picture of him in disguise to fool the masses) and continued to try to mail letters to world leaders to try to form a world peace organization. Those kinds of thoughts do not plague the minds of non-schizophrenics, whether inner our perceived outer voices.

I have experienced auditory, visual, and tactile hallucinations. Usually they are very brief episodes brought on by stress, lack of sleep, and my anxiety and/or depression being bad. Sometimes they happen when I'm daydreaming deeply and possible skirt the edge of waking and sleeping.

Once I had a hallucination while on cannabis.

So perhaps because I have had these experiences I'm less frightened of people who have schizophrenia than most people I know. I realize that even the healthiest brain can work oddly when under the right pressures or in certain environments.

I wish we knew more about the causes of schizophrenia and I really really wish we had more education on it, but it's wonderful that more awareness is being raised. Too often, we only see the rare, violent schizophrenic episodes on the news and not all the people who quietly live life with the illness.
